metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1010006 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Evince 3.26.0 is affected by buffer overflow. The impact is: DOS / Possible code execution. The component is: backend/tiff/tiff-document.c. The attack vector is: Victim must open a crafted PDF file. The issue occurs because of an incorrect integer overflow protection mechanism in tiff_document_render and tiff_document_get_thumbnail.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1010006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

evince - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6
evince-common - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6
evince-gtk - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6
gir1.2-evince-3.0 - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6
libevdocument3-4 - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6
libevview3-3 - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: atril: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
evince package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.2-1ubuntu4.6').
